The chairman of the Midlands Engine was guest speaker at a new awards ceremony in the city aimed at building business links between the East and West Midlands. 
Sir John Peace said partnership and collaboration were key to a prosperous future when he spoke at the inaugural Nachural Entrepreneurship Awards at the King Power Stadium. 
Sir John, who is also the chair of the Burberry fashion group, spoke about the potential of the Midlands Engine to deliver employment, improved infrastructure and an enhanced international reputation for the region. 
He also spoke further about the Burberry business model and also the future prospects of the global marketplace while recognising post-Brexit challenges. 
He was recognised with a lifetime achievement award on the night. Nachural awards event organiser Ninder Johal (left) with Julius Peter Moto, High Comissioner of Uganda, and keynote speaker Sir John Peace 
Event organiser Ninder Johal said the awards were created to recognise the contribution business makes to the region – from start-ups to those that had matured. 
It included companies that want to disrupt the traditional marketplace and emphasised the importance on international and community work. 
Mr Johal, a past president of the Black Country Chamber of Commerce and a Black Country local enterprise partnership board member, spoke about UK growth over the last 12 months but warned about the slowing down of the global economy and the uncertainties around Brexit and global protectionism. 
He also highlighted the need to collaborate and work together to safeguard funding for crucial issues such as transport infrastructure and local skills development. Nachural Awards (l-r) Salim Mulzi of NRI legal services, Panna Pujara of Help PCF.org, Dilruba Islam & Shaf Islam of Chutney Ivy restaurant, Hitesh Pujara of Help PCF.org & Mukesh Naker of BIPF think tank 
The winners on the night were: 
Start-up of the year – Online estate agent Doorsteps 
Hospitality Business of the Year – Chutney Ivy , in Leicester 
Community – ISA Support Services, Birmingham 
Entrepreneur of the year – Sameer Karim of DWS Solicitors, Leicester 
International and Enterprise – Clifton Packaging , Leicester 
Business Woman of the Year – Kala Patel , MD of Kiddycare Nurseries, Leicester 
Business Person of the Year – Rafique Patel , senior partner of Bond Adams Solicitors, Leicester 
Promoting Apprenticeships in the Workplace – DJ’s Groom Room and Sandra May Hair Salon , in Cank Street, Leicester 
Business of the Year – Yu Energy , Nottingham 
Highly commended on the night were Electrical Design and MFG co Ltd , in Oadby, and Nita Nanda , who works for Holland and Barratt in Leicester. 
The charity on the night was BEC UK and the host for the evening was BBC Asian Network presenter Tommy Sandhu. Like us on Facebook
